headline: BrightNight and Cordelio reach financial close for 1,200MWh Arizona BESS
summary_80w: IPPs BrightNight and Cordelio Power have reached financial close on the 300MWac solar PV, 300MW/1,200MWh battery energy storage system (BESS) Pioneer Clean Energy Centre in Yuma, Arizona, US.

headline: Akaysha Energy bags AU$460 million for 1,244MWh BESS in Victoria, Australia
summary_80w: BlackRock-backed Akaysha Energy has secured AU$460 million (US$299 million) in construction financing for its 311MW/1,244MWh Elaine battery energy storage system (BESS) in Victoria, Australia.

headline: Origin Energy secures AEMO Connection Agreements for 650MWh grid-forming BESS in Australia
summary_80w: Origin Energy has secured unconditional connection agreements with AEMO for its 300MW/650MWh grid-forming BESS at Mortlake Power Station in Victoria.

headline: Italy NZIA auction closes with 1.8GW solar requests, France awards C&I PV tender
summary_80w: The French and Italian solar markets have both moved forward in their latest public tender process for solar capacity.

headline: SolarEdge ships 1.47GW of inverters in Q3 amid optimism for C&I sales
summary_80w: Inverter manufacturer SolarEdge sold close to 1.5GW of inverters in the third quarter of the year, driving revenue of US$340.2 million.

headline: Chinese polysilicon producers see improved profits, module makers still struggling
summary_80w: Third-quarter results show a clear split in the fortunes of China’s leading polysilicon and module producers, writes Carrie Xiao.

headline: European PV module prices stabilise ‘at the bottom’ in October
summary_80w: The low volatility displayed in PV module prices in Europe has reached a sustained equilibrium between production and demand in October, according to online solar marketplace sun.store.

headline: Osaka Gas and Sonnedix to build BESS at 38.7MW solar PV project in Japan
summary_80w: Osaka Gas and Sonnedix have announced plans to install a BESS at the latter's 38.7MW Oita solar project in Japan.

headline: Pacific Energy completes solar module installation at 35MW plant in Western Australia
summary_80w: Pacific Energy has completed the installation of all 66,000 solar modules for a 35MW solar PV plant at a Western Australian mining site.

headline: Has the time once again arrived for utility-scale silicon carbide?

headline: GridStor’s 440MWh Texas BESS begins operations

headline: Spain allocates €840 million funds for storage projects, passes grid resilience decree
summary_80w: The government of Spain has chosen the 143 energy storage projects that will receive capex support from an EU-backed scheme, totalling nearly 9GWh of capacity.

headline: TotalEnergies’ possible German BESS divestment ‘mainly about recycling capital’
summary_80w: TotalEnergies is reportedly considering selling a stake of 'about 50%' in a portfolio of BESS projects in Germany it is deploying via Kyon Energy.

headline: HyperStrong Charts New Blueprint for Global BESS Success: The Integration Edge
summary_80w: In a BESS market where success hinges on rapid, high-performance, and cost-effective deployment, the role of the system integrator has never been more critical.

headline: Gotion High-Tech, Clou Electronics, Eve Battery and Kstar show strong performance in Q3
summary_80w: As China enters Q4 2025, the capacity utilisation rate of the country’s energy storage battery manufacturing capacity will remain high, a trade body said.

headline: Aggressive pricing and emerging C&I models reshape India’s energy storage outlook
summary_80w: India’s energy storage industry is at a turning point as developers, financiers, and policymakers work to define viable business models for the next wave of large-scale battery projects.

headline: Xcel Energy plans 600MW ‘US Midwest’s largest BESS project’ in Minnesota

headline: AGL seeks federal approval for 2,000MWh battery storage system in Queensland, Australia
summary_80w: Australian energy giant AGL has submitted its 500MW/2,000MWh Tuckeroo Battery project for federal environmental approval.

headline: South Africa to add 28.7GW of new solar PV generation capacity by 2039
summary_80w: South Africa aims to add 28.7GW of new solar PV generation capacity by 2039, and generate over half of its electricity with renewables by 2042.

headline: Digging into delamination distress: Why too many PV modules are failing at the edges
summary_80w: Kiwa PVEL examines the increased number of delamination issues and how a different BOM can impact a module's reliability.

headline: Voltec Solar and Toyo ink TOPCon PV cell supply deal

headline: Solv Energy to build 209MW Texas solar project for Sol Systems

headline: Spain passes decree strengthening grid resilience and boosting energy storage

headline: Anker SOLIX on surviving 55°C heat and coastal corrosion in Australian conditions
summary_80w: PV Tech spoke with Symons Xie, general manager of Anker SOLIX APAC, at All-Energy Australia 2025, where the organisation outlined its strategy for establishing a major presence in Australia's rapidly growing home battery and energy storage market.

headline: Australia’s home battery rebate processes ‘8,000 applications weekly’ as storage capacity surges

headline: Lack of pricing consensus slows down European PPA deals – Pexapark

headline: ContourGlobal closes first US solar project financing for 324MW Colorado project

headline: Illinois: Advocates, industry welcome clean energy legislation that includes 3GW energy storage target

headline: France introduces grid tariff reforms for energy storage

headline: Enphase revenues rise, tariffs impact margin in Q3
